DOC.brief_summary: This trial design test whether granulocyte colony stimulate factor ( G-CSF , Neupogen ) increase rate embryo implantation follow IVF embryo transfer . Preliminary data Center Human Reproduction ( CHR ) elsewhere suggest intrauterine infusion G-CSF improve endometrial development increase implantation rate embryos .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Colony Stimulating Factor Implantation Pregnancy Rates Following IVF ( Vitro Fertilization )
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To investigate effect treatment CSF pregnancy rate routine vitro fertilization ( IVF ) . Design : Double blind crossover randomize control clinical trial Setting : Academically affiliated private infertility center Subjects : Normal female IVF patient 18-38 year old , age 38 year , willing randomize treatment . Interventions : Subjects receive transvaginally , utilize insemination catheter , slow uterine lavage G-CSF ( Neupogen ) , 300ug ( 1 ml ) ; control receive saline . Patients conceive , one month washout time , continue treatment opposite study arm . Main Outcome Measures : Implantation rate ( IR ) pregnancy rate . Second Outcome Measures : Live birth rate miscarriage rate . Statistical Power consideration : Analysis regression IR dependent treatment independent . Results adjust age index ovarian reserve , antiMulerian Hormone ( AMH ) . Presuming implantation rate 10 % anticipate 10 % increase 20 % treatment , 120 woman , produce 200 embryo study arm , recruit 80 % power alpha 0.05 .
DOC.criteria: Women already enrol IVF cycle one participating institution Sickle Cell disease Renal insufficiency Upper respiratory infection Pneumonia Chronic Neutropenia Known Past present malignancy
